content: My instinct was to say, with contrition: "I'm sorry, sir, I'm not prepared" - a considerable indignity - but in a rare moment of inspiration I decided to concoct a bluff, however lame. Said I: "Well, sir, this case was obviously meant to get us to... but I didn't do any of that. The case said that XYZ Company was in a very competitive industry... there would be no point in charging less than everyone else either. So I figured they should just keep charging what everybody else was charging, and I didn't do any calculations." Ahem. The professor blew his stack.
source: The Only Investment Guide You'll Ever Need
author: Andrew Tobias
